page.title: 03ROADSIDE STUDIES
page.content: During the beginning of July 1985 we, (the second year of St Aldhelms School Sherborne),surveyed the plants growing alongside two of the three roads which run through our block. They are both country roads, sometimes as narrow as 10feet (3m) and hedged both sides. {Soft_stemmed plants _}We sampled these using quadrats on the verges. The results were : Grass 70% Clover 6.1% Dandelion 4.7% Plantain 4.6% Dock 4% Nettle 2.2% Cow Parsley 1.8% Daisy 1% Thistle 0.9% Speedwell 0.9% Moss 0.7% Yarrow 0.6% Bindweed 0.6% Black Meddick 0.3% Vetch 0.3% Goosegrass 0.3% Buttercup 0.2% Milk Thistle 0.2% Campion 0.1% Wild Rhubarb 0.1% Red Dead Nettle 0.1%Foxglove 0.06% Wh.Dead Nettle 0.06%Bracken 0.06%
